Comments_List: Analytical essay writing skills, research paper skills
This course allowed me the ability to cultivate and harness sound knowledge that has since changed my overall perspective on how sound interacts with me in everyday circumstances.
This course improved my writing skills considerably
Critical reading of essays, understanding of sound and music, effective persuasive writing skills.

This course was very helpful in developing my writing skills and my verbal communication skills in the small classroom seminar. I also was able to think about sound in a very different way than before, which was especially cool and exciting.
Skills in literary analysis and writing techniques.
Loved how modern the course was and how we were able to listen to music along with reading
This course could focus on teaching students in a step-by-step manner how to approach writing in a clear-cut manner instead of leaving them to figure it out on their own.
This was a great course that perfectly balanced assigned readings with listening materials and class discussions. I feel like my writing improved, and I thoroughly enjoyed attending class every day.
Yes! Loved this course because it was so fun and modern. Catered to many interests within music
Yes, although it is intense in terms of workload, it is ultimately worth it. You feel good about yourself after taking the course as it makes you a confident writer.
Yes, I learned a lot from it.
Definitely! I really enjoyed this course! As a science person I was initially very hesitant about taking an English course, but this one was very enjoyable and I learned a lot!
Yes. It will improve your writing and make you a better student.

This is a really engaging course about music in society. No prior knowledge other than a general interest in listening to music is required. Professor Tazudeen is incredible at leading discussion and is always available to discuss paper ideas or class content further. I hate writing, but I loved this class.
